title.narrative: Mechanism 18614 - Local Capacity Initiative

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
Based on the conclusions drawn in the 2012 National Forum on Sustainability of Health Building Actions, held in Santo Domingo, the National Sustainability Plan (NSP) 2015-2018 outlines the unsustainability risks for national NGOs. Therefore, the actions in the new NSP include the strengthening of Civil Society and contemplate the promotion of incidence processes to improve the access to integral s Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.13: Health System Strengthening. Include activities that contribute to national, regional or district level systems by supporting finance, leadership and governance (include broad policy reform efforts including stigma, gender, etc.), institutional capacity building, supply chain or procurement systems, Global Fund programs and donor coordination. objectives

Based on the conclusions drawn in the 2012 National Forum on Sustainability of Health Building Actions, held in Santo Domingo, the National Sustainability Plan (NSP) 2015-2018 outlines the unsustainability risks for national NGOs. Therefore, the actions in the new NSP include the strengthening of Civil Society and contemplate the promotion of incidence processes to improve the access to integral services for key populations and the quality of the services provided, in an environment free of stigma and discrimination. It has been noted that NGOs play an important role in the access to prevention and care services for populations difficult to access, ensuring an improved coverage of diverse services and goods; other documents have described the role they have played in different processes of reform, human rights, gender equality and generating opportunities for the most vulnerable.
INSALUD will support the development of a collective coordination structure and governance, a network of care providers comprised of NGOs providing services to key populations, within the framework of the 90-90-90 initiative, that articulate different actions that currently are being developed by NGOs in different areas of performance, defining the areas of: health promotion, prevention, care and social control, a financial platform integrated by the NGOs providing services to key populations within the framework of the 90-90-90 initiative that become the financial sustainability of these organizations, a team that promotes actions of entrepreneurship, development of business plans, marketing and management of public-private partnerships, and a technical and technological platform that can integrate, develop, monitor and follow the development of actions required to achieve sustainability.

participating-org.narrative: Instituto Nacional de la Salud Insalud

organisation.narrative: Office of the Global AIDS Coordinator

mailing-address.narrative: 1800 G Street, N.W., Suite 10300, Washington, DC 20006

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.

title.narrative: This area of the State Department website contains the standard terms and conditions documents incorporated by reference into all standard grants, cooperative agreements, fixed amount awards, award to individuals, and property awards to U.S. and foreign recipients that are not Foreign Public Entities.
